title: PII leakage due to scrceenshot of health records
content:
Summary:
Document shows a screenshot of a medical record for a soldier
Description:
One of the slides describes the CIV# and PAD DSN# along with some information relating to the soldier such as their name, the information appears to be old but could be still be an issue if they're in service
## Impact
High? maybe critical? Unsure on impact
## Step-by-step Reproduction Instructions
Check slide 13 specifically but there's other slides that are suspect too
https://███████/wp-content/uploads/2018/12/HR_TECH_WOBC_Perform_eMILPO_Functions_eMILPO_Brief.pptx
Product, Version, and Configuration (If applicable)
N/A
## Suggested Mitigation/Remediation Actions
Purge Doc
Impact
An attacker could assume soldier identities and learn more about possible health information related to them
steps: Navigate to slide 13 (and potentially other slides) to view the screenshot of the medical record containing PII (CIV#, PAD DSN#, soldier's name, etc.)
vuln_description: The vulnerability involves the exposure of Personally Identifiable Information (PII) and sensitive health records of a soldier through a screenshot embedded in a publicly accessible PowerPoint presentation. The leaked data could potentially be used for identity theft or to gather sensitive health information about the soldier.
reason: The vulnerability is straightforward to discover as it involves accessing a publicly available document and identifying exposed PII within its contents. There are no complex interactions, application states, or novel logic involved in the discovery process.
